questionTitle: There is a ________ of $10.000 for information leading to the arrest of criminals.
He didn't pay for the meal himself - he put it on his company's ________ account.
I knew him ________ I was a child.
We ________ them run away from the accident.
I only have ________ days left in England, so I want to see as much as possible before I go.
He pretended that he agreed with me to avoid ________ my feelings.
Many fires could be ________ if new regulations were introduced.
My watch had stopped so I had no way of knowing the right ________.
A professor recently came ________ an unknown poem by Shakespeare while he was looking through an old book.
I could never beat Harry at chess; I'm just not in his ________.
Too much exercise can be harmful but walking is good ________ you.
I find it difficult to talk to Cecilia because we have so ________ in common.
Daniel's attitude ________ his parents is very disrespectful.
Surely David's not going to drive, ________ he?
You ________ pay for this information. It's free.
You learn a language best ________.
anwers: when being brought up to it
by being brought up to it

questionTitle: It is generally assumed, however, that urgent discussions will continue ________ to bring the two sides together.
His house is nothing out of the ________, it's just an average four-room house.
a ladies' man = ________.
anwers: a man most women fall for
a man who enjoys the company of women
a man who dresses up like a woman
a man everybody feels sorry for

questionTitle: Mary was very annoyed that her secretary did not meet her deadlines, and she warned her that her laziness and ________ could result in her dismissal.
